meanings.definition: The quality or state of being theatrical.
meanings.sent1: Her theatricality on stage captivated the audience.
meanings.sent2: The play lacked theatricality, making it boring to watch.
meanings.sent3: His theatricality in everyday conversations always brought a smile to people's faces.
meanings.sent4: The theatricality of the storm outside matched the intensity of the argument inside.
meanings.sent5: The theatricality of the magician's performance left everyone in awe.

meanings.definition: The use of exaggerated gestures or behavior to create a dramatic effect.
meanings.sent1: The actor's theatricality in the comedy scene was hilarious.
meanings.sent2: The dancer's theatricality added flair to the performance.
meanings.sent3: Her theatricality in telling stories always made them more entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The theatricality of his excuses was so over-the-top that no one believed him.
meanings.sent5: The theatricality of the chef's presentation made the dish even more appetizing.
